item.description:
Report X-2025060312

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: PITTSFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND PACKAGE FOUND LEAKING ON A PACKAGE CAR SHELF. PACKAGE WAS MOVED TO DMP AREA, TESTED FOR PH AND SHOWED A PH OF 0. LEAKED CONTENTS OF PACKAGE ON SHELF IN PACKAGE CAR WAS NEUTRALIZED WITH SODIUM BICARBINATE AND CLEANED.

item.title: Report X-2025051995
item.description:
Report X-2025051995

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN THE UNLOAD TRAILER ON DOCK 8. THE UNLOADER NOTICED A FULLY REGULATED PACKAGE ON ITS SIDE WITH A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID LEAKING OUT OF THE CORNER. HE STOPPED UNLOADING, LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025060293
item.description:
Report E-2025060293

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-17
  • City: EAST DEERFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Berkshire & Eastern Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TILX112017 was found leaking hydrochloric acid on Track 4W in Deerfield Yard. At approximately 2100 hours, Hepaco LLC, mobilized to site with three technicians, one supervisor, and one pickup truck. Hepaco LLC arrived onsite at 2330 hours and conducted safety briefing, received track protection. Hepaco worked with railroad and shipper to approve corrections. At 0200 hours TILX112017 tank car was corrected and secured. Hepaco secured area and decontaminated equipment that was used. Apparent cause of incident concluded (Liquid Line A was less than tool tight, Liquid Line B was missing a gasket on the blind flange, and there were multiple gaskets on vapor line flange. Gasket installed on flange, flange secured, and security seals attached.

item.title: Report X-2025051307
item.description:
Report X-2025051307

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: SOMERVILLE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY THREE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING MRNA AND DNA SAMPLES. THIS PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS ONE NON-REGULATED KOOLIT REFRIGERANTS GEL PACK. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2025060263
item.description:
Report E-2025060263

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: BOSTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: JETBLUE AIRWAYS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival F172 CUN-BOS requested a GSC to be present due to inflight crew found an overheat/leaking vaping device. When flight landed in Boston, our of caution, Mass State Police and Massport Fire Rescue were present for assistance. The Fire Rescue Team took the possession of the vape pen after they examined the vaping device. Later on we learned from inflight crew that customer seated in 10F, Mr. Daniel Conroy volunteered to give up his vape pen after he noticed it was getting hot. Inflight crew then took the possession of the vaping device following overheating device procedures.

item.title: Report E-2025060243
item.description:
Report E-2025060243

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: EAST BOSTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: JETBLUE AIRWAYS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CUSTOMER STATES THAT WHILE IN DESCENT ON BOARD A A321 AIRCRAFT (AIRCRAFT REGISTRATION # N946JL) ON FLIGHT 988 FROM LAX TO BOSTON, A FIRE OCCURRED, RELEASING SMOKE INTO THE PLANE CABIN WHEN HIS PIXLE 8 BECAME WEDGED IN THE SEAT BACK AS HE MOVED IT TO THE UPRIGHT POSITION FOR LANDING AT BOS. THIS CAUSED THE LITHIUM ION BATTERY WITHIN TO GO INTO THERMAL RUNAWAY. NO INJURIES OR DAMAGES REPORTED.
